did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: American Legion Johnson-Frederickson Post No. 98 Collection
did.abstract: The American Legion Collection contains information about Georgetown's Johnson-Frederickson Post, No. 98, of the American Legion.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the G&B Cultural Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item Description, Date], American Legion Johnson-Frederickson Post No. 98 Collection, [Item no., Box no.], G&B Cultural Center, Wilton, Conn.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Johnson-Frederickson Post, No. 98, American Legion was founded in Georgetown, Conn., in or soon after 1921. Founding members included men with prominent Georgetown family names, such as Connery, Bennett, and Bouton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the American Legion Collection is made up of award certificates. There are also a small amount of official correspondence, realia, and periodicals.
